content.description: CHANGES IN CITY INFRASTRUCTURE FOR A SMALL- TO MEDIUM-SIZED CITY DURING THE 2010s
content.question: Park acreage added 104 acres Miles of paved bike trails added 27 miles Community center and fitness center spaces expanded 27,000 square feet Seats in all-day public preschool-kindergarten added 173 Trees planted along streets and in city-owned properties 7,210 Downtown electric-vehicle recharging stations installed 24 Which of the following best explains the city planning trends shown in the data table?

choices.label: Business development efforts have been made to increase the prices charged for commercial real estate.
Transit-oriented development efforts have been made to decrease traffic and reduce the city's carbon footprint.
Mixed-use development efforts have been made to increase the integration of residential and commercial land use.
Economic development efforts have been made to improve benefits for employees working in the city.
Social development efforts have been made to improve the quality of life for city residents.

content.answer: Social development efforts have been made to improve the quality of life for city residents.

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
